intro: Tephrosia boiviniana f. annua, commonly known as the annual tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and the plant is known for its potential medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields.
